result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Yanira Gonzalez-Santoyo in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz appeared by video. Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Yanira Gonzalez-Santoyo in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Yanira Gonzalez-Santoyo in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Yanira Gonzalez-Santoyo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
